review: Hands down the best streaming box I've ever tried (I've used various Rokus and Chromecasts).  Snappier and cleaner interface than the rest and looks nicer on the component shelf too.  If you use amazon prime regularly, this is the way to go.  Also, the voice search with the remote is great!
author: Bill Brasky

review: Fire TV (2014)It's fast, has a sleek UI, best in class remote control and all Apps you need. An Apple fan
author: Marcus Rosebrock

review: Very easy to set up. However, once set up, I dare you to find the "huge number of games and apps" in any sort of systematic way. When the search function is used, it only applies to Amazon Prime movie and television content, so the only way to search for apps is to scroll through them, in large icons that move across the screen in random order. There needs to be a way to search for apps.The games available are mostly lame, free-for-a-reason titles that have all the appeal of Pong. Why won't amazon with all it's clout gain access to the cool stuff.Also, if it was a TV show that I really wanted to watch, it was at least 2.99 an episode.The Pacific and some other made for cable series are great, and some of them are free.I do believe that "literally 1,000s of movies, apps..." is a little exaggerated, but all the content providers use that line.It's a work in progress, I hope.
author: Linda Waud

review: Lots of potential - have had it freeze on us and give "unknown_error" twice already in less than 2 weeks.  After phoning support and rebooting, it lost my settings for Netflix and so had to re-peck out username and passwords all over again - this should be so much better than it is!
